User: I am a Family Medicine doctor with permanent nerve damage, ED, and bladder issues from a botched back surgery with multiple mistakes made; missed diagnosis, negligent failure to treat, and delay in diagnosis/care. During my L3 micro-discectomy in December of 2022, Dr. Kade Huntsman cut a vertebral vein, then claimed to have stopped the bleeding, however it bled around my spinal cord, causing an epidural hematoma and then EMG changes (my legs went dead below the knees) that were ignored by the surgeon's PA while he was closing. The Surgeon had left the OR to do another case (claiming he was already in the other OR, which is impossible). Upon awakening, I had cauda-equina syndrome and laid there for 45 minutes before the surgeon returned and reopened my back. He had conflicting documentation regarding the epidural hematoma he evacuated, but by then the damage was done. I was out of work for 4.5 months, relearned how to walk, have permanent nerve damage from L3-S2 on an EMG, and diagnosed with a neurogenic bladder. This has changed my life and I can no longer do near the activities I used to. I promise you this is a case we can win because of my medical knowledge and your expertise, thank you.
